pageContext.claim: “But the bottom line is, President Obama gave me 142 openings when I first got there. Normally, you would have -- there's never been anything like that. Normally, you would have no opening [on federal courts].”
pageContext.analysis: There were 88 district and 17 court of appeals vacancies when Trump took office, so a total of 105 -- not through Obama's lack of effort. Senate Republicans refused to move on his nominations.
